title: Warm Sautéed Cabbage with Lemon–Maple Finish
description: A quick, bright, lightly sweet cabbage side that pairs cleanly with rosemary chicken, chicken burgers, or roasted potatoes. High-volume, low-calorie, and designed to avoid overpowering flavours.
ingredients: 1 small green cabbage, thinly sliced (about 6–7 cups)
Optional: 1/4 teaspoon sesame oil for aroma
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced cabbage and kosher salt. Sauté for 6–8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage softens and some edges begin to brown.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Add the lemon juice and maple syrup, stirring to coat the cabbage evenly.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Add red pepper flakes or sesame oil if desired.
Cook 1 additional minute until glossy and lightly caramelized. Serve warm.
notes: For a burger topping version, cook only 3–4 minutes to keep the cabbage crisper. Use sesame oil sparingly—it goes a long way. Green cabbage is preferred here; red cabbage stays too firm and gets earthy with rosemary.
